Basic Exclusion Options

Overview
The Class Names options
The Field Names options
The Method Names options
Default Exclusions

Overview

When obfuscating classes, you don't always want every package, class, field and method name to be changed. For example, when obfuscating a set of classes that will be used as a library by third parties, you don't want to obfuscate package names, public class names or public or protected field or method names. Zelix KlassMaster gives you the ability to exclude the names of specified objects from being changed.

The basic Exclusion Options window allows you to set broad exclusions primarily based upon the access modifiers of objects. If finer control is required click on to go to the "Advanced Exclusion Options" window.

 

The "Class names" Options

If you are obfuscating all classes in an application or applet, it is recommended that you deselect "exclude public class names" and "exclude package class names". If you are obfuscating a class library it is recommended that you select "exclude public class names".

If you select:

  • "exclude public class names" then no public class names will be changed.
  • "exclude package class names" then no package (default) class names will be changed.
  • "exclude public class names" and "exclude package class names" then no class names will be changed.

Warning

If any opened classes are extended by classes that haven't been opened then obfuscation of the extended class names will break the extending classes. Zelix KlassMaster does not check for this situation.

Exclude package qualifiers

If "exclude package qualifiers" is selected, Zelix KlassMaster will exclude package qualifiers from being changed. If the field to the right of this option is left blank then all package names will be excluded. If a package qualfier is entered then only those package qualifiers will be excluded.

For example, if there were three classes with the fully qualified names

  • package1.package2.class1
  • package1.package2.package3.class1
  • package4.class1
and you specified that the package names package1.package2 should be excluded then the changed class names would be
  • package1.package2.class1
  • package1.package2.a.class1
  • a.class1

Don't change main class name

Applications are started by running a class that contains a "main" method. It is usually desirable that this class have a user friendly name. To ensure this, select the "don't change main class name" option and select your main class from the list box. All opened classes that contain a "main" method will appear in the list.

The "Field names" Options

If you are obfuscating a stand alone application or applet, it is recommended that you don't select any of the Field Names check boxes. If you are obfuscating a class library it is recommended that you select "exclude public field names" and "exclude package field names". The use of Field Names check boxes is straightforward:
  • If you select "exclude public field names" then public field names will not be changed.
  • If you select "exclude protected field names" then protected field names will not be changed.
  • If you select "exclude package field names" then package (default) field names will not be changed.
  • If you select "exclude private field names" then private field names will not be changed.
If all boxes are selected then no field names will be changed.

The "Method names" Options

If you are obfuscating a stand alone application or applet, it is recommended that you don't select any of the Method Names check boxes. If you are obfuscating a class library it is recommended that you select "exclude public method names" and "exclude package method names". The use of Method Names check boxes is straightforward:
  • If you select "exclude public method names" then public method names will not be changed.
  • If you select "exclude protected method names" then protected method names will not be changed.
  • If you select "exclude package method names" then package (default) method names will not be changed.
  • If you select "exclude private method names" then private method names will not be changed.
If all boxes are selected then no method names will be changed.

Exceptions

The name of the method "main" will not normally be changed because it is excluded by default.

A method name will not be changed if

  • the method overrides a method in a superclass that hasn't been opened or
  • the method implements a method in an interface that hasn't been opened.
Also, a protected or package method name will not be changed if
  • the method is overridden in some subclass by a public method and
  • public method names are not being changed.
Zelix KlassMaster uses the path defined in the classpath option when searching for unloaded classes.

Warning

If any methods in opened classes are overridden by classes that haven't been opened then obfuscation of the overridden method names will break the extending classes. Zelix KlassMaster does not check for this situation.

Default Exclusions

Zelix KlassMaster has some default exclusions that are applied everytime you obfuscate. However, you may override these defaults with your own. The commercial version of Zelix KlassMaster looks for a file in the current user directory named defaultExclude.txt. If it finds the file then it will use its contents as the default exclusions.

If the defaultExclude.txt file doesn't exist then Zelix KlassMaster applies its predefined default exclusions which are listed below:

  • *.* public static main(java.lang.String[])
  • *.<link>_Skel implements java.rmi.server.Skeleton   //RMI
  • *.<link>_Stub extends java.rmi.server.RemoteStub   //RMI
  • *._<link>_Stub extends javax.rmi.CORBA.Stub   //RMI with iiop
  • *._<link>_Tie implements javax.rmi.CORBA.Tie   //RMI with iiop
  • interface *.* implements java.rmi.Remote *(*) throws java.rmi.RemoteException +signatureClasses   //RMI
  • *.<link>BeanInfo   //JavaBeans™
  • *.<link>Customizer   //JavaBeans™
  • *.* implements javax.ejb.EJBHome public create(*)   //EJB Home
  • *.* implements javax.ejb.EJBHome public find*(*)   //EJB Home
  • *.* implements javax.ejb.EJBObject public *(*)   //EJB Remote
  • *.* implements javax.ejb.EnterpriseBean public *(*)   //EJB Bean
  • *.* private readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream)   //Serialization
  • *.* private writeObject(java.io.ObjectOutputStream)   //Serialization
  • *.* writeReplace()   //Serialization
  • *.* readResolve()   //Serialization
  • *.* readObjectNoData() throws java.io.ObjectStreamException   //Serialization
  • *.* java.io.ObjectStreamField[] serialPersistentFields   //Serialization
  • *.* static final long serialVersionUID   //Serialization
  • *.^*^ native *(*) +signatureClasses   //native methods
See the ZKM Script Language exclude statement documentation for an explanation of the effect of these default exclusions.
